These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
trade leave no trace build leave a legacee settle wood ® you have arrived on the island of catan. its uninhabited lands lie before you, stretching for miles in all directions. it offers the promise of bountiful harvests and plentiful resources. as you make plans to build a new life here, you discover that you are not alone. several other newly - arrived leaders are planning their futures here as well. the race to build a bright and prosperous new community has begun! the catan® – 5 - 6 player extension™ ( aka

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
a bright and prosperous new community has begun! the catan® – 5 - 6 player extension™ ( aka catan 5 - 6 ) allows you to add one to two players to your catan games. the island is larger, the demand for resources is fiercer, and the thrills are even greater! note : this 2022 revision has new “ paired player ” rules that replace the special building phase found in previous editions of catan 5 - 6. longtime catan fans should take note. you can download the new rules from catan. com

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
- 6. longtime catan fans should take note. you can download the new rules from catan. com for free. g c ame omponents to play catan 5 - 6, you need nearly all of the components from the catan base game, plus the following pieces : 88 • • • • • • • • • • 11 terrain hexes 4 small sea frames 28 number tokens ( 1 desert, 2 ea. forest, hills, pasture, ( 2 with harbors, 2 without ) ( brown text on back ) fields,

vp cards for the win. 2 building costs cards player 1 and player 2 markers 25 resource 9 development 2 optional with plastic bases cards cards harbor pieces note : when you want to play with 3 - 4 players again, we have made it easy to separate the cardboard catan 5 - 6 components from the catan components. • look at the front of the terrain hexes. the catan 5 - 6 hexes all have a watermark icon ( depicted here ) printed in the lower left corner. catan terrain hexes have no watermarks. • look

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
depicted here ) printed in the lower left corner. catan terrain hexes have no watermarks. • look at the back of the number tokens. the letters on the back of the a a catan 5 - 6 tokens are dark brown. the letters on the standard catan number tokens are black. 22 g r 5 - 6 p ame ules for layers except as noted below, catan 5 - 6 uses the same rules found in catan. the additional rules include : • assembling the larger board ( add small frame

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
rules found in catan. the additional rules include : • assembling the larger board ( add small frame pieces ) • creating the supply ( add more cards ) • the 5 - 6 player set - up phase • the paired players turn s 5 - 6 p g etting up a layer ame assembling the larger board to begin each game, you need to assemble the board. catan 5 - 6 uses a board very similar to the one in catan, but expanded with additional small sea frames. note : the 5 and 6 player games

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
the one in catan, but expanded with additional small sea frames. note : the 5 and 6 player games use all of the hexagonal tiles from catan 5 - 6 and all of the tiles from the catan base game. however, you only use the number tokens from this extension ( lettered a to y and za, zb, and zb ). assemble the frame as specified in catan and add the 4 small sea frame pieces from catan 5 - 6 as shown here : • place the small “ 2 - 2 ”

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
sea frame pieces from catan 5 - 6 as shown here : • place the small “ 2 - 2 ” all - sea frame add the small sea frames piece between the “ 2 - 2 ” joint of the catan frames ( a ). dd 1 1 6 6 • place the small “ 3 - 3 ” 2 : 1 wool harbor 6 frame piece between the 6 aa “ 3 - 3 ” joint of the catan frames ( b ). 2 2 • place the samll “ 5 - 5 ” 3 : 1 harbor 2 2 frame piece between the

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
2 2 • place the samll “ 5 - 5 ” 3 : 1 harbor 2 2 frame piece between the “ 5 - 5 ” joint of 5 5 the catan frames ( c ). cc 5 5 • place the small “ 6 - 6 ” all - sea frame piece between the “ 6 - 6 ” joint of the 3 3 catan frames ( d ). bb 3 3 4 4 33 create the supply add the 25 resource cards and 9 development cards to the cards for 3 - 4 players. sort the resource cards into 5 stacks. put them

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
9 development cards to the cards for 3 - 4 players. sort the resource cards into 5 stacks. put them face up beside the board. shuffle the development cards and place them face down beside the board. these card stacks form the supply. place the “ longest road ” and “ largest army ” special vp cards beside the supply. the 5 - 6 player set - up phase take your starting pieces select a color and take your 5 settlements, 4 cities, and 15 roads. also take your color ’ s “ building costs ” card. if this is your first

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
, and 15 roads. also take your color ’ s “ building costs ” card. if this is your first 5 - player game, see the note on page 5. for your first 5 - 6 player game : use the starting set - up for 5 - 6 new players ( see image on page 5 ). once set - up is complete, give each player their starting resources hh from the settlements marked with white stars ( ) as shown. for 5 - 6 experienced players : once you are comfortable with the 5 - 6 player rules, add the terrain

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
for 5 - 6 experienced players : once you are comfortable with the 5 - 6 player rules, add the terrain hexes to the frame as follows : 1. shuffle all 30 terrain hexes face down and place them face down inside the frame. 2. t urn the hexes face up, without changing their location. 3. take the number tokens from catan 5 - 6 ( brown letters on back ). place the number token labeled “ a ” on any one of the six corner hexes ( we chose the upper right in our example on

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
“ a ” on any one of the six corner hexes ( we chose the upper right in our example on page 5 ). continue placing the tokens in alphabetical order along a spiral, starting on the outside hexes and proceeding counter - clockwise toward the center of the board. place each token so that the numbered side is facing up. when the series of tokens reaches a desert hex, skip over that hex and continue on the other side. note : the last three tokens are each marked with two letters : za, zb,

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
other side. note : the last three tokens are each marked with two letters : za, zb, zc. 4. place the robber on either of the desert hexes. optional : some experienced players like to randomize their harbors. to do so, random harbor here ’ s how : take the 11 harbor pieces ( 9 from catan + 2 from catan 5 - 6 ) and option shuffle them face down. randomly place them on top of each harbor on the frame as shown. starting settlements and resources 44 starting set - up for

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
them on top of each harbor on the frame as shown. starting settlements and resources 44 starting set - up for 5 - 6 new players * 1 1 6 6 11 00 66 red • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • wwhhiittee 6 6 66 22 99 1111 • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 2 2 33 1111 55 1100 44 • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
• • • • • 3 3 green brown 4 4 * for your first 5 player number token placement order game : one color remains inactive in the game. to determine which color, a player takes 1 road of each c b a color and hides them in d q p o their hand. each player takes 1 road at random r y x n from this hand ( unseen ). the remaining road is e s za zc w m the inactive color. leave f t zb l that color ’ s settlements on the board as inactive g u v k settlements

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
. leave f t zb l that color ’ s settlements on the board as inactive g u v k settlements, but remove the roads. this will h i j maintain a fair starting set - up for all players. 55 • each player, in turn, rolls the dice to determine the starting player as in catan. • place your first 2 settlements, 2 roads, and receive your starting resources, using the method described in set - up on page 12 of the catan almanac. n r 5 - 6 p ew ules for layers the

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
page 12 of the catan almanac. n r 5 - 6 p ew ules for layers the phases used in catan remain the same – resource production, trade, and build. for 5 - 6 players, use the new paired player rules during trading and building. note : if you have played previous versions of catan 5 - 6, this paired player rule replaces the special building phase. determine the paired players • if you are the starting player, place the player 1 marker in front of yourself. • place the player 2 marker in front of

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
starting player, place the player 1 marker in front of yourself. • place the player 2 marker in front of the third player to the left of player 1. note : for the remainder of these rules, we will refer to the players with these markers as player 1 and player 2, respectively. paired player rules the phases used in catan remain generally the same. player 1 rolls the dice for the turn. however, during the trade / build phase, both player 1 and player 2 can take actions. player 1 must always complete their portion of the paired turn

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
, both player 1 and player 2 can take actions. player 1 must always complete their portion of the paired turn before player 2 can begin their portion. paired players 5 players 6 players the third player to the left of the the third player to the left of the starting player is player 2. starting player is player 2. 3. 2. 3. 2. 1. 1. the starting player the starting player is player 1. is player 1. 66 paired player turn order player 1 performs this part of a turn just as you would in catan. •

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
66 paired player turn order player 1 performs this part of a turn just as you would in catan. • begin the turn with the production dice roll. all players take their resources ( or any “ 7 ” roll is resolved ) as usual in catan. the combined trade / build phase is slightly different with the paired players rule. player 1 goes first and may do the following in any order : • trade resource cards with all players as usual and trade resource cards with the supply as usual. • build anything shown on your “ building costs ” card and play

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
trade resource cards with the supply as usual. • build anything shown on your “ building costs ” card and play 1 development card as usual. after player 1 completes their portion of the paired turn, player 2 takes their part of the paired turn. player 2 may do the following in any order : • trade cards only with the supply. • build anything shown on your “ building costs ” card and play 1 development card as usual ( even vp cards to win the game ). after player 2 completes their part of the turn, the paired players each pass their respective

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
win the game ). after player 2 completes their part of the turn, the paired players each pass their respective markers to the player on their left. player 1 also passes the dice. the new player 1 starts a new turn. ending the game clarifications you win the game if you are the first player to reach 10 or more victory points on your turn ( as in catan ). however, if there is ever an instance when both player 1 and player 2 reach 10 points during the same turn, player 1 wins the game before player 2 can

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
player 1 and player 2 reach 10 points during the same turn, player 1 wins the game before player 2 can take their part of the paired turn. 77 player 1 and 2 actions overview player 1 player 2 roll for production ( mandatory ) trade with other players and the supply trade with the supply only build build play 1 development card play 1 development card c redits design : klaus teuber art : michael menzel, pete fenlon graphic design : pete fenlon, michaela kienle, and ron magin production : ron magin, alex colon hernandez

These rules apply to the Base 5 to 6 players game
fenlon, michaela kienle, and ron magin production : ron magin, alex colon hernandez, az sperry paired player turn development : team catan special thanks : gavin allister, brea blankenfeld, arnd beenen, sebastian castro casas, morgan dontanville, pete fenlon, arnd fischer, jasmin fuss, ralph hamor ( lskc / 1 - 804 ), sonja krutzfeldt, stephanie newman, donna prior, anne reynolds, kelli schmitz,
